sources: ACOG - American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists

safeIngredients.name: Water
safeIngredients.why: Essential for all body functions; stay well hydrated during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Salt
safeIngredients.why: Essential mineral; iodized salt provides important iodine for baby's brain development.

safeIngredients.name: Sugar
safeIngredients.why: Safe in moderation; provides quick energy but limit excessive intake.

safeIngredients.name: Brown Sugar
safeIngredients.why: Same as white sugar with added molasses; safe in normal amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Powdered Sugar
safeIngredients.why: Just finely ground sugar; safe in normal food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Honey
safeIngredients.why: Safe for pregnant women (only unsafe for infants under 1 year). Natural energy source.

safeIngredients.name: Maple Syrup
safeIngredients.why: Natural sweetener with some minerals; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Molasses
safeIngredients.why: Good source of iron and calcium; beneficial during pregnancy in moderation.

safeIngredients.name: Agave
safeIngredients.why: Natural sweetener; safe but high in fructose so use moderately.

safeIngredients.name: Wheat Flour
safeIngredients.why: Staple ingredient enriched with folic acid and iron - both important for pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Whole Wheat Flour
safeIngredients.why: Higher fiber and nutrients than white flour; excellent choice during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Rice Flour
safeIngredients.why: Gluten-free grain flour; safe and easily digestible.

safeIngredients.name: Corn Flour
safeIngredients.why: Good source of fiber and energy; naturally gluten-free.

safeIngredients.name: Oat Flour
safeIngredients.why: Excellent fiber source; may help with pregnancy constipation and blood sugar control.

safeIngredients.name: Cornstarch
safeIngredients.why: Simple thickening agent; completely safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Tapioca Starch
safeIngredients.why: Natural starch from cassava root; gluten-free and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Potato Starch
safeIngredients.why: Natural vegetable starch; safe and commonly used thickener.

safeIngredients.name: Arrowroot
safeIngredients.why: Gentle, easily digestible starch; traditionally used for upset stomachs.

safeIngredients.name: Modified Food Starch
safeIngredients.why: Starch modified for better texture; FDA approved and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Milk
safeIngredients.why: Excellent source of calcium, protein, and vitamin D for baby's bone development.

safeIngredients.name: Cream
safeIngredients.why: Dairy fat; safe when pasteurized. Good source of fat-soluble vitamins.

safeIngredients.name: Butter
safeIngredients.why: Natural dairy fat; provides vitamin A and energy. Safe in normal amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Cheese
safeIngredients.why: Great protein and calcium source. Stick to pasteurized cheeses during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Cheese Cultures
safeIngredients.why: Beneficial bacteria used to make cheese; completely safe.

safeIngredients.name: Yogurt
safeIngredients.why: Probiotics support digestive health; calcium and protein benefit pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Sour Cream
safeIngredients.why: Cultured dairy product; safe when made from pasteurized cream.

safeIngredients.name: Buttermilk
safeIngredients.why: Cultured milk with probiotics; aids digestion and provides calcium.

safeIngredients.name: Whey
safeIngredients.why: High-quality protein from milk; supports baby's growth and development.

safeIngredients.name: Casein
safeIngredients.why: Main protein in milk; provides essential amino acids for baby's development.

safeIngredients.name: Lactose
safeIngredients.why: Natural milk sugar; safe unless you're lactose intolerant.

safeIngredients.name: Nonfat Dry Milk
safeIngredients.why: Concentrated milk nutrients; adds protein and calcium to foods.

safeIngredients.name: Eggs
safeIngredients.why: Complete protein with choline essential for baby's brain. Cook thoroughly during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Egg Whites
safeIngredients.why: Pure protein; safe when cooked. Used in many baked goods.

safeIngredients.name: Egg Yolks
safeIngredients.why: Rich in choline and healthy fats important for baby's brain development.

safeIngredients.name: Vegetable Oil
safeIngredients.why: Common cooking oils; provide essential fatty acids and vitamin E.

safeIngredients.name: Olive Oil
safeIngredients.why: Heart-healthy monounsaturated fat; contains antioxidants beneficial during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Coconut Oil
safeIngredients.why: Contains medium-chain fats; safe during pregnancy in normal food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Palm Oil
safeIngredients.why: Common cooking oil; provides vitamin E. Safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Sesame Oil
safeIngredients.why: Flavorful oil with antioxidants; used in many Asian dishes. Safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Avocado Oil
safeIngredients.why: High in healthy monounsaturated fats and vitamin E; excellent choice during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Grapeseed Oil
safeIngredients.why: Light, neutral oil high in vitamin E; safe for cooking and dressings.

safeIngredients.name: Flaxseed Oil
safeIngredients.why: Rich in omega-3 fatty acids which support baby's brain development.

safeIngredients.name: Shortening
safeIngredients.why: Solid fat for baking; safe in normal recipe amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Lard
safeIngredients.why: Traditional cooking fat; safe and contains vitamin D.

safeIngredients.name: Chicken
safeIngredients.why: Lean protein source; cook to 165°F to ensure safety during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Beef
safeIngredients.why: Excellent iron and protein source; cook to safe temperature during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Pork
safeIngredients.why: Good protein and B-vitamin source; cook to 145°F minimum during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Turkey
safeIngredients.why: Lean protein similar to chicken; cook thoroughly during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Salmon
safeIngredients.why: Excellent omega-3 source for baby's brain; low mercury. One of the best fish choices during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Tilapia
safeIngredients.why: Low-mercury white fish; good protein choice during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Cod
safeIngredients.why: Mild white fish low in mercury; safe 2-3 times per week during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Shrimp
safeIngredients.why: Low in mercury and calories, high in protein; safe when cooked thoroughly.

safeIngredients.name: Crab
safeIngredients.why: Low-mercury shellfish; safe when fully cooked during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Lobster
safeIngredients.why: Low in mercury; enjoy occasionally when fully cooked.

safeIngredients.name: Sardines
safeIngredients.why: Small fish very low in mercury; excellent omega-3 and calcium source.

safeIngredients.name: Anchovies
safeIngredients.why: Tiny fish with minimal mercury; good omega-3 source.

safeIngredients.name: Pollock
safeIngredients.why: Low-mercury white fish; common in fish sticks and imitation crab.

safeIngredients.name: Catfish
safeIngredients.why: Farm-raised catfish is low in mercury; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Trout
safeIngredients.why: Low-mercury freshwater fish; good omega-3 source.

safeIngredients.name: Herring
safeIngredients.why: Small fatty fish low in mercury; excellent omega-3 source.

safeIngredients.name: Soy
safeIngredients.why: Complete plant protein; safe during pregnancy despite myths. Good iron source.

safeIngredients.name: Tofu
safeIngredients.why: Excellent plant protein with calcium and iron; beneficial during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Tempeh
safeIngredients.why: Fermented soy with probiotics; good protein and iron source.

safeIngredients.name: Pea Protein
safeIngredients.why: Allergen-friendly plant protein; safe and nutritious during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Wheat Gluten
safeIngredients.why: Plant protein from wheat; safe unless you have celiac disease.

safeIngredients.name: Gelatin
safeIngredients.why: Protein from collagen; supports skin and joint health. Safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Collagen
safeIngredients.why: Protein supporting skin elasticity; may help with pregnancy stretch marks.

safeIngredients.name: Tomato
safeIngredients.why: Rich in lycopene and vitamin C; supports immune health during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Onion
safeIngredients.why: Adds flavor and contains prebiotics for gut health; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Garlic
safeIngredients.why: Natural antimicrobial and immune booster; safe in culinary amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Celery
safeIngredients.why: Low-calorie vegetable with folate and fiber; good snack during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Carrot
safeIngredients.why: Excellent vitamin A (beta-carotene) source for baby's eye development.

safeIngredients.name: Potato
safeIngredients.why: Good source of potassium, vitamin C, and energy; supports pregnancy nutrition.

safeIngredients.name: Bell Pepper
safeIngredients.why: Very high in vitamin C; supports iron absorption and immune function.

safeIngredients.name: Spinach
safeIngredients.why: Excellent folate source critical for preventing birth defects; also high in iron.

safeIngredients.name: Kale
safeIngredients.why: Nutrient powerhouse with folate, calcium, and iron; great for pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Broccoli
safeIngredients.why: High in folate, fiber, and vitamin C; excellent pregnancy vegetable.

safeIngredients.name: Cauliflower
safeIngredients.why: Good source of folate and fiber; versatile low-carb vegetable.

safeIngredients.name: Corn
safeIngredients.why: Good fiber and B-vitamin source; naturally sweet and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Peas
safeIngredients.why: Good protein, fiber, and folate; excellent addition to pregnancy diet.

safeIngredients.name: Green Beans
safeIngredients.why: Low-calorie vegetable with fiber and folate; safe and nutritious.

safeIngredients.name: Black Beans
safeIngredients.why: Excellent plant protein, fiber, and iron source; great for pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Kidney Beans
safeIngredients.why: High in protein, fiber, and folate; must be fully cooked.

safeIngredients.name: Pinto Beans
safeIngredients.why: Good fiber and protein source; common in Mexican cuisine.

safeIngredients.name: Navy Beans
safeIngredients.why: Mild white beans high in fiber and iron; versatile and nutritious.

safeIngredients.name: Lentils
safeIngredients.why: Excellent folate and iron source; one of the best foods for pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Chickpeas
safeIngredients.why: High in protein, fiber, and folate; very beneficial during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Mushrooms
safeIngredients.why: One of few food sources of vitamin D; also provides B vitamins.

safeIngredients.name: Cabbage
safeIngredients.why: High in vitamin C and fiber; supports immune function.

safeIngredients.name: Lettuce
safeIngredients.why: Low-calorie green with some folate; wash thoroughly before eating.

safeIngredients.name: Cucumber
safeIngredients.why: Hydrating and refreshing; good for pregnancy nausea and swelling.

safeIngredients.name: Zucchini
safeIngredients.why: Low-calorie vegetable with folate and potassium; easy to digest.

safeIngredients.name: Squash
safeIngredients.why: Rich in beta-carotene and fiber; excellent source of vitamins A and C.

safeIngredients.name: Pumpkin
safeIngredients.why: High in beta-carotene, fiber, and potassium; nutritious during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Asparagus
safeIngredients.why: Excellent folate source; also provides fiber and vitamins A, C, K.

safeIngredients.name: Artichoke
safeIngredients.why: High in fiber and folate; supports digestive health during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Brussels Sprouts
safeIngredients.why: High in folate, fiber, and vitamin C; excellent pregnancy vegetable.

safeIngredients.name: Beets
safeIngredients.why: Good source of folate and iron; supports blood production during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Turnips
safeIngredients.why: Root vegetable with vitamin C and fiber; safe and nutritious.

safeIngredients.name: Radishes
safeIngredients.why: Low-calorie crunchy vegetable; provides vitamin C and fiber.

safeIngredients.name: Eggplant
safeIngredients.why: Contains fiber and antioxidants; safe during pregnancy when cooked.

safeIngredients.name: Avocado
safeIngredients.why: Excellent source of folate and healthy fats for baby's brain development.

safeIngredients.name: Olives
safeIngredients.why: Good source of healthy fats and vitamin E; enjoy in moderation due to sodium.

safeIngredients.name: Apple
safeIngredients.why: Good fiber and vitamin C source; may help with pregnancy constipation.

safeIngredients.name: Orange
safeIngredients.why: Excellent vitamin C and folate source; supports immune function and iron absorption.

safeIngredients.name: Lemon
safeIngredients.why: High in vitamin C; lemon water may help with morning sickness.

safeIngredients.name: Lime
safeIngredients.why: Good vitamin C source; adds flavor without calories.

safeIngredients.name: Grapefruit
safeIngredients.why: High in vitamin C; check for medication interactions but otherwise safe.

safeIngredients.name: Banana
safeIngredients.why: Excellent potassium source; may help with pregnancy leg cramps and nausea.

safeIngredients.name: Strawberry
safeIngredients.why: High in vitamin C and folate; excellent pregnancy fruit choice.

safeIngredients.name: Blueberry
safeIngredients.why: Antioxidant-rich; supports brain health and immune function.

safeIngredients.name: Raspberry
safeIngredients.why: High in fiber and vitamin C; excellent for pregnancy nutrition.

safeIngredients.name: Blackberry
safeIngredients.why: Rich in fiber, vitamin C, and antioxidants; great pregnancy fruit.

safeIngredients.name: Grape
safeIngredients.why: Good source of vitamins and antioxidants; raisins provide iron.

safeIngredients.name: Cranberry
safeIngredients.why: May help prevent urinary tract infections common during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Cherry
safeIngredients.why: Contains melatonin which may help with sleep; good antioxidant source.

safeIngredients.name: Peach
safeIngredients.why: Good source of vitamins A and C; supports skin health during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Pear
safeIngredients.why: Good fiber source; gentle on the stomach during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Plum
safeIngredients.why: Prunes help with pregnancy constipation; good fiber and potassium source.

safeIngredients.name: Apricot
safeIngredients.why: High in beta-carotene and iron; dried apricots are a nutritious snack.

safeIngredients.name: Mango
safeIngredients.why: Excellent vitamin A and C source; supports immune function.

safeIngredients.name: Papaya
safeIngredients.why: Ripe papaya is safe and high in vitamin C; avoid unripe papaya.

safeIngredients.name: Pineapple
safeIngredients.why: Good vitamin C source; safe during pregnancy despite old myths.

safeIngredients.name: Watermelon
safeIngredients.why: Hydrating and refreshing; may help with swelling and heartburn.

safeIngredients.name: Cantaloupe
safeIngredients.why: High in vitamins A and C; wash rind before cutting to avoid contamination.

safeIngredients.name: Honeydew
safeIngredients.why: Hydrating melon with potassium; good for staying hydrated.

safeIngredients.name: Kiwi
safeIngredients.why: Very high in vitamin C and fiber; supports immune function and digestion.

safeIngredients.name: Coconut
safeIngredients.why: Coconut water helps with hydration; coconut provides healthy fats.

safeIngredients.name: Dates
safeIngredients.why: Natural sweetener with fiber; studies suggest may help with labor.

safeIngredients.name: Figs
safeIngredients.why: Good source of fiber, calcium, and potassium; nutritious pregnancy snack.

safeIngredients.name: Pomegranate
safeIngredients.why: High in antioxidants and folate; may support placental health.

safeIngredients.name: Guava
safeIngredients.why: Extremely high in vitamin C; supports immune function during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Passion Fruit
safeIngredients.why: Good source of fiber and vitamins A and C; safe and nutritious.

safeIngredients.name: Dragon Fruit
safeIngredients.why: Contains fiber and vitamin C; mild flavor and safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Lychee
safeIngredients.why: Good vitamin C source; enjoy fresh or canned in moderation.

safeIngredients.name: Black Pepper
safeIngredients.why: Common spice; safe in culinary amounts and may help with digestion.

safeIngredients.name: White Pepper
safeIngredients.why: Milder than black pepper; safe in normal cooking amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Paprika
safeIngredients.why: Rich in vitamin C and antioxidants; adds color and flavor safely.

safeIngredients.name: Cayenne Pepper
safeIngredients.why: Safe in culinary amounts; may help with circulation and congestion.

safeIngredients.name: Chili Powder
safeIngredients.why: Blend of spices; safe in normal recipe amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Cumin
safeIngredients.why: Good iron source; aids digestion. Safe in culinary amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Coriander
safeIngredients.why: Digestive aid with some iron; safe and commonly used worldwide.

safeIngredients.name: Turmeric
safeIngredients.why: Anti-inflammatory; safe in food amounts. Avoid high-dose supplements.

safeIngredients.name: Ginger
safeIngredients.why: Clinically proven to help with morning sickness and nausea.

safeIngredients.name: Cinnamon
safeIngredients.why: May help with blood sugar control; safe in culinary amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Nutmeg
safeIngredients.why: Safe in small culinary amounts; avoid large quantities.

safeIngredients.name: Allspice
safeIngredients.why: Warm baking spice; safe in typical recipe amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Cloves
safeIngredients.why: Aromatic spice safe in culinary amounts; has antimicrobial properties.

safeIngredients.name: Cardamom
safeIngredients.why: Aromatic spice; may help with nausea. Safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Mustard
safeIngredients.why: Common condiment; safe and adds flavor without many calories.

safeIngredients.name: Fennel
safeIngredients.why: May help with digestion and bloating; safe in culinary amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Anise
safeIngredients.why: Licorice-flavored spice; safe in culinary amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Oregano
safeIngredients.why: Common herb with antioxidants; safe in cooking amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Basil
safeIngredients.why: Flavorful herb high in vitamin K; safe in culinary amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Thyme
safeIngredients.why: Aromatic herb with antimicrobial properties; safe in cooking.

safeIngredients.name: Rosemary
safeIngredients.why: Contains antioxidants; safe in culinary amounts used for flavoring.

safeIngredients.name: Sage
safeIngredients.why: Savory herb; safe in normal cooking amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Parsley
safeIngredients.why: Good source of vitamin K and C; safe as a garnish and flavoring.

safeIngredients.name: Dill
safeIngredients.why: Flavorful herb; may help with digestion. Safe in culinary amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Mint
safeIngredients.why: May help with nausea and digestion; safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Bay Leaf
safeIngredients.why: Used for flavoring; remove before eating. Safe in cooking.

safeIngredients.name: Tarragon
safeIngredients.why: Mild anise-flavored herb; safe in culinary amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Chives
safeIngredients.why: Mild onion flavor with some folate; safe and nutritious.

safeIngredients.name: Marjoram
safeIngredients.why: Similar to oregano; safe in normal cooking amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Vanilla
safeIngredients.why: Common flavoring; alcohol in extract evaporates during baking.

safeIngredients.name: Almond Extract
safeIngredients.why: Concentrated flavoring; safe in typical recipe amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Lemon Extract
safeIngredients.why: Concentrated citrus flavoring; safe in baking.

safeIngredients.name: Orange Extract
safeIngredients.why: Concentrated citrus flavoring; safe in typical amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Peppermint Extract
safeIngredients.why: Concentrated mint flavor; safe in recipe amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Cocoa
safeIngredients.why: Contains antioxidants and small amount of caffeine; safe in moderation.

safeIngredients.name: Chocolate
safeIngredients.why: Contains caffeine; enjoy in moderation (1-2 servings/day fine).

safeIngredients.name: Coffee
safeIngredients.why: Contains caffeine - count toward 200mg daily limit during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Vinegar
safeIngredients.why: Safe acid used for flavoring and preservation; may help with digestion.

safeIngredients.name: Citric Acid
safeIngredients.why: Natural acid found in citrus fruits; safe preservative and flavoring.

safeIngredients.name: Lactic Acid
safeIngredients.why: Naturally produced in fermentation; safe and common in dairy products.

safeIngredients.name: Malic Acid
safeIngredients.why: Natural acid from apples; safe flavoring and preservative.

safeIngredients.name: Tartaric Acid
safeIngredients.why: Natural acid from grapes; safe in baking and as a preservative.

safeIngredients.name: Phosphoric Acid
safeIngredients.why: Used in sodas; safe in food amounts though limit sugary drinks.

safeIngredients.name: Fumaric Acid
safeIngredients.why: Natural acid; safe as food acidulant.

safeIngredients.name: Ascorbic Acid
safeIngredients.why: Essential vitamin; supports immune function and iron absorption.

safeIngredients.name: Baking Soda
safeIngredients.why: Common leavening agent; safe in baking. May help with heartburn.

safeIngredients.name: Baking Powder
safeIngredients.why: Combination leavening agent; completely safe in baking.

safeIngredients.name: Yeast
safeIngredients.why: Living organism for bread; nutritional yeast is high in B vitamins.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin A
safeIngredients.why: Essential for baby's development; get from food, don't oversupplement.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin B1
safeIngredients.why: Essential B vitamin for energy and nerve function; safe and needed.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin B2
safeIngredients.why: Essential for growth and red blood cell production; safe.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin B3
safeIngredients.why: Supports digestion, skin, and nerves; safe in food/prenatal amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin B5
safeIngredients.why: Essential for making blood cells and converting food to energy.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin B6
safeIngredients.why: May help with morning sickness; essential for baby's brain development.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin B9
safeIngredients.why: CRITICAL for pregnancy - prevents neural tube defects. Take before and during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin B12
safeIngredients.why: Essential for nerve function and DNA synthesis; important for baby's development.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin C
safeIngredients.why: Supports immune function and iron absorption; essential during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin D
safeIngredients.why: Essential for calcium absorption and baby's bone development.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin E
safeIngredients.why: Antioxidant important for immune function; safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Vitamin K
safeIngredients.why: Essential for blood clotting; safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Iron
safeIngredients.why: CRITICAL during pregnancy - blood volume increases 50%. Prevents anemia.

safeIngredients.name: Calcium
safeIngredients.why: Essential for baby's bone and teeth development; need 1000mg daily.

safeIngredients.name: Magnesium
safeIngredients.why: Supports muscle and nerve function; may help with leg cramps.

safeIngredients.name: Potassium
safeIngredients.why: Helps maintain fluid balance and nerve function; important during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Zinc
safeIngredients.why: Essential for baby's cell growth and immune function.

safeIngredients.name: Copper
safeIngredients.why: Works with iron to form red blood cells; essential in small amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Manganese
safeIngredients.why: Trace mineral for bone formation; safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Selenium
safeIngredients.why: Antioxidant that supports thyroid function; essential in small amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Iodine
safeIngredients.why: CRITICAL for baby's brain development and thyroid function.

safeIngredients.name: Chromium
safeIngredients.why: Helps regulate blood sugar; safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Biotin
safeIngredients.why: Supports healthy hair, skin, and nails; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Choline
safeIngredients.why: Important for baby's brain development; often under-consumed.

safeIngredients.name: Inositol
safeIngredients.why: B-vitamin-like substance; may help with gestational diabetes prevention.

safeIngredients.name: Pectin
safeIngredients.why: Natural fiber from fruit; safe thickener used in jams and jellies.

safeIngredients.name: Agar
safeIngredients.why: Plant-based gelatin alternative from seaweed; completely safe.

safeIngredients.name: Guar Gum
safeIngredients.why: Natural fiber thickener; safe and may help with constipation.

safeIngredients.name: Xanthan Gum
safeIngredients.why: Natural thickener from fermentation; safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Locust Bean Gum
safeIngredients.why: Natural thickener from carob seeds; completely safe.

safeIngredients.name: Cellulose
safeIngredients.why: Plant fiber used for texture; safe and adds fiber.

safeIngredients.name: Lecithin
safeIngredients.why: Natural emulsifier containing choline; safe and beneficial.

safeIngredients.name: Mono and Diglycerides
aliases: mono and diglycerides of fatty acids
safeIngredients.why: Common emulsifiers from vegetable oils; safe in food.

safeIngredients.name: Annatto
safeIngredients.why: Natural orange-yellow color from seeds; safe plant-based dye.

safeIngredients.name: Beta Carotene
safeIngredients.why: Natural orange color that converts to vitamin A; safe and nutritious.

safeIngredients.name: Caramel Color
safeIngredients.why: Made from heated sugar; safe though provides no nutrition.

safeIngredients.name: Turmeric Color
safeIngredients.why: Natural yellow from turmeric root; safe with anti-inflammatory properties.

safeIngredients.name: Paprika Color
safeIngredients.why: Natural red-orange from peppers; safe and adds some antioxidants.

safeIngredients.name: Beet Juice Color
safeIngredients.why: Natural red from beets; completely safe plant-based color.

safeIngredients.name: Spirulina Color
safeIngredients.why: Natural blue-green from algae; safe and nutritious.

safeIngredients.name: Chlorophyll
safeIngredients.why: Natural green from plants; completely safe.

safeIngredients.name: Rice
safeIngredients.why: Staple grain; enriched varieties provide folate and iron.

safeIngredients.name: Barley
safeIngredients.why: Whole grain with fiber and B vitamins; supports digestive health.

safeIngredients.name: Quinoa
safeIngredients.why: Complete protein with all amino acids; excellent pregnancy food.

safeIngredients.name: Millet
safeIngredients.why: Gluten-free grain with iron and B vitamins; safe and nutritious.

safeIngredients.name: Buckwheat
safeIngredients.why: Despite the name, gluten-free; good source of fiber and minerals.

safeIngredients.name: Rye
safeIngredients.why: Whole grain with fiber; may help with constipation.

safeIngredients.name: Spelt
safeIngredients.why: Ancient wheat variety; more protein than regular wheat.

safeIngredients.name: Amaranth
safeIngredients.why: Gluten-free ancient grain; high in protein, iron, and calcium.

safeIngredients.name: Teff
safeIngredients.why: Tiny grain very high in iron and calcium; excellent for pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Sorghum
safeIngredients.why: Gluten-free grain with antioxidants; safe and nutritious.

safeIngredients.name: Almonds
safeIngredients.why: Excellent source of vitamin E, calcium, and healthy fats.

safeIngredients.name: Peanuts
safeIngredients.why: Good protein source; studies show eating during pregnancy may reduce baby's allergy risk.

safeIngredients.name: Walnuts
safeIngredients.why: Excellent omega-3 source for baby's brain development.

safeIngredients.name: Cashews
safeIngredients.why: Good source of iron, zinc, and magnesium; supports pregnancy nutrition.

safeIngredients.name: Pecans
safeIngredients.why: Rich in healthy fats and antioxidants; supports heart health.

safeIngredients.name: Hazelnuts
safeIngredients.why: Good source of vitamin E and healthy fats; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Macadamia Nuts
safeIngredients.why: High in healthy monounsaturated fats; safe and satisfying.

safeIngredients.name: Pistachios
safeIngredients.why: Good source of protein, fiber, and antioxidants.

safeIngredients.name: Brazil Nuts
safeIngredients.why: Excellent selenium source; 1-2 per day meets selenium needs.

safeIngredients.name: Pine Nuts
safeIngredients.why: Good source of vitamin E and minerals; commonly used in pesto.

safeIngredients.name: Chestnuts
safeIngredients.why: Lower in fat than other nuts; good source of fiber and vitamin C.

safeIngredients.name: Sunflower Seeds
safeIngredients.why: Excellent vitamin E and folate source; great pregnancy snack.

safeIngredients.name: Pumpkin Seeds
safeIngredients.why: High in iron, zinc, and magnesium; excellent for pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Flax Seeds
safeIngredients.why: Best plant source of omega-3s; supports baby's brain development.

safeIngredients.name: Chia Seeds
safeIngredients.why: High in omega-3s, fiber, and calcium; superfood for pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Sesame Seeds
safeIngredients.why: Good source of calcium, iron, and healthy fats.

safeIngredients.name: Hemp Seeds
safeIngredients.why: Complete protein with omega-3s; does not contain THC.

safeIngredients.name: Poppy Seeds
safeIngredients.why: Small amounts in food are safe; good source of minerals.

safeIngredients.name: Caraway Seeds
safeIngredients.why: Traditional digestive aid; safe in culinary amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Soy Sauce
safeIngredients.why: Safe in normal amounts; choose low-sodium if watching salt intake.

safeIngredients.name: Worcestershire Sauce
safeIngredients.why: Fermented condiment; safe in cooking and flavoring.

safeIngredients.name: Hot Sauce
safeIngredients.why: Safe during pregnancy; may help with congestion.

safeIngredients.name: Ketchup
safeIngredients.why: Tomato-based condiment; safe though watch sugar content.

safeIngredients.name: Mayonnaise
safeIngredients.why: Commercial mayo uses pasteurized eggs; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Salsa
safeIngredients.why: Fresh vegetable condiment; nutritious and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Hummus
safeIngredients.why: Made from chickpeas; excellent source of protein and fiber.

safeIngredients.name: Guacamole
safeIngredients.why: Made from avocados; excellent source of healthy fats and folate.

safeIngredients.name: Dextrose
safeIngredients.why: Simple sugar same as blood glucose; safe in normal food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Maltodextrin
safeIngredients.why: Easily digestible carbohydrate; safe as food ingredient.

safeIngredients.name: Invert Sugar
safeIngredients.why: Sugar broken into glucose and fructose; safe sweetener.

safeIngredients.name: Corn Syrup
safeIngredients.why: Different from HFCS; simple glucose syrup safe in moderation.

safeIngredients.name: Rice Syrup
safeIngredients.why: Natural sweetener from rice; safe alternative to other syrups.

safeIngredients.name: Fruit Juice Concentrate
safeIngredients.why: Concentrated fruit sugar; natural sweetener safe in moderation.

safeIngredients.name: Erythritol
safeIngredients.why: Zero-calorie sweetener; well-tolerated and safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Sorbitol
safeIngredients.why: May cause digestive discomfort in large amounts; safe in moderation.

safeIngredients.name: Mannitol
safeIngredients.why: Sugar alcohol; may cause digestive issues if overconsumed.

safeIngredients.name: Xylitol
safeIngredients.why: Safe sweetener that may help prevent cavities.

safeIngredients.name: Isomalt
safeIngredients.why: Low-calorie sweetener; safe though may cause digestive issues in excess.

safeIngredients.name: Maltitol
safeIngredients.why: Sugar alcohol used in sugar-free products; safe in moderation.

safeIngredients.name: Smoke Flavor
safeIngredients.why: Made from actual smoke; safe flavoring for meats and vegetables.

safeIngredients.name: Enzymes
safeIngredients.why: Natural proteins that aid food production; safe.

safeIngredients.name: Cultures
safeIngredients.why: Beneficial bacteria; probiotics may help with digestion and immunity.

safeIngredients.name: Inulin
safeIngredients.why: Prebiotic fiber supporting gut health; may help with constipation.

safeIngredients.name: Psyllium
safeIngredients.why: Natural fiber that helps with pregnancy constipation.

safeIngredients.name: Oat Fiber
safeIngredients.why: Soluble fiber supporting digestive health; may help lower cholesterol.

safeIngredients.name: Wheat Fiber
safeIngredients.why: Insoluble fiber supporting digestive regularity.

safeIngredients.name: Bamboo Fiber
safeIngredients.why: Plant fiber used for texture; safe and adds fiber.

safeIngredients.name: Acacia Fiber
safeIngredients.why: Soluble fiber and prebiotic; gentle on the stomach.

safeIngredients.name: Apple Fiber
safeIngredients.why: Fiber from apple processing; safe and nutritious.

safeIngredients.name: Citrus Fiber
safeIngredients.why: Fiber from citrus processing; safe food ingredient.

safeIngredients.name: Goat Milk
safeIngredients.why: Nutritious alternative to cow's milk; provides calcium and protein.

safeIngredients.name: Oat Milk
safeIngredients.why: Popular plant milk; often fortified with calcium and vitamin D.

safeIngredients.name: Almond Milk
safeIngredients.why: Low-calorie plant milk; choose fortified versions for calcium.

safeIngredients.name: Rice Milk
safeIngredients.why: Hypoallergenic plant milk; gentle on the stomach.

safeIngredients.name: Soy Milk
safeIngredients.why: Complete protein plant milk; closest to cow's milk nutritionally.

safeIngredients.name: Coconut Milk Beverage
safeIngredients.why: Light coconut milk for drinking; often fortified with vitamins.

safeIngredients.name: Lamb
safeIngredients.why: Rich in iron, zinc, and B12; cook to safe temperature during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Duck
safeIngredients.why: Good iron and protein source; cook thoroughly during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Bison
safeIngredients.why: Lean red meat high in iron and protein; lower fat than beef.

safeIngredients.name: Venison
safeIngredients.why: Lean game meat high in iron; cook to safe internal temperature.

safeIngredients.name: Scallops
safeIngredients.why: Low-mercury shellfish; good source of protein and B12 when cooked.

safeIngredients.name: Mussels
safeIngredients.why: High in iron, B12, and omega-3s; cook until shells open.

safeIngredients.name: Clams
safeIngredients.why: Excellent iron source; one of the highest iron foods available. Cook thoroughly.

safeIngredients.name: Okra
safeIngredients.why: Good source of folate and fiber; common in Southern and Indian cuisine.

safeIngredients.name: Parsnip
safeIngredients.why: Root vegetable rich in folate, fiber, and potassium.

safeIngredients.name: Rutabaga
safeIngredients.why: Root vegetable with vitamin C and fiber; mild and versatile.

safeIngredients.name: Jicama
safeIngredients.why: Crunchy root vegetable high in fiber and vitamin C; refreshing snack.

safeIngredients.name: Watercress
safeIngredients.why: Nutrient-dense green with vitamin K, C, and calcium.

safeIngredients.name: Bok Choy
safeIngredients.why: Good source of calcium, vitamins A and C; excellent during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Edamame
safeIngredients.why: High in folate, protein, and fiber; excellent pregnancy snack.

safeIngredients.name: Barbecue Sauce
safeIngredients.why: Tomato-based condiment; safe though watch sugar content.

safeIngredients.name: Teriyaki Sauce
safeIngredients.why: Soy-based sauce; safe in normal cooking amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Miso
safeIngredients.why: Fermented soy paste with probiotics; safe and provides protein.

safeIngredients.name: Coconut Sugar
safeIngredients.why: Lower glycemic than white sugar; contains some minerals.

safeIngredients.name: Monk Fruit
safeIngredients.why: Natural zero-calorie sweetener; considered safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Sodium Phosphate
safeIngredients.why: Common food additive for texture and preservation; safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Sodium Citrate
safeIngredients.why: Derived from citric acid; safe flavoring and buffering agent.

safeIngredients.name: Calcium Propionate
safeIngredients.why: Mold inhibitor in bread; safe and FDA approved.

safeIngredients.name: Gellan Gum
safeIngredients.why: Natural gelling agent from fermentation; safe food additive.

safeIngredients.name: Konjac
safeIngredients.why: Natural fiber from konjac plant; helps with fullness and constipation.

safeIngredients.name: Carnauba Wax
safeIngredients.why: Natural plant wax used as coating on candies and pills; safe.

safeIngredients.name: Beeswax
safeIngredients.why: Natural wax used as glazing agent; completely safe.

safeIngredients.name: Shellac
safeIngredients.why: Natural resin used as coating on candy and pills; safe.

safeIngredients.name: Sodium Alginate
safeIngredients.why: Seaweed-derived thickener; safe and provides soluble fiber.

safeIngredients.name: Tara Gum
safeIngredients.why: Natural thickener from tara seeds; safe food additive.

safeIngredients.name: Acacia Gum
safeIngredients.why: Natural tree gum; safe prebiotic fiber used in many foods.

safeIngredients.name: Glycerin
safeIngredients.why: Safe humectant keeping foods moist; derived from vegetable fats.

safeIngredients.name: Cream of Coconut
safeIngredients.why: Thick coconut product; safe and provides healthy fats.

safeIngredients.name: Tamarind
safeIngredients.why: Tropical fruit used in sauces; good source of B vitamins and minerals.

safeIngredients.name: Seaweed
safeIngredients.why: Good source of iodine for baby's brain; also provides minerals.

safeIngredients.name: Jackfruit
safeIngredients.why: Tropical fruit high in fiber and vitamin C; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Persimmon
safeIngredients.why: Rich in vitamins A and C; sweet fruit safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Sourdough Starter
safeIngredients.why: Wild yeast and bacteria culture; may make bread easier to digest.

safeIngredients.name: Cream Cheese
safeIngredients.why: Made from pasteurized milk; safe and provides calcium.

safeIngredients.name: Mascarpone
safeIngredients.why: Italian cream cheese made from pasteurized cream; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Paneer
safeIngredients.why: Fresh cheese made by curdling pasteurized milk; safe protein source.

safeIngredients.name: Monocalcium Phosphate
safeIngredients.why: Common leavening agent in baking powder; FDA approved and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Sodium Acid Pyrophosphate
safeIngredients.why: Leavening agent used in baked goods and potatoes; FDA approved and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Fructose
safeIngredients.why: Natural sugar found in fruit; safe in normal food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Golden Syrup
safeIngredients.why: British cane sugar syrup; safe sweetener in baking.

safeIngredients.name: Trehalose
safeIngredients.why: Natural sugar found in mushrooms and honey; FDA approved and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Semolina
safeIngredients.why: Coarse wheat flour used in pasta and bread; good source of protein and B vitamins.

safeIngredients.name: MCT Oil
safeIngredients.why: Medium-chain fats from coconut; easily digested and safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Spices
safeIngredients.why: Generic term for culinary spices; safe in normal cooking amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Italian Seasoning
safeIngredients.why: Blend of oregano, basil, thyme, and rosemary; safe culinary herbs.

safeIngredients.name: Curry Powder
safeIngredients.why: Spice blend with turmeric, cumin, coriander; safe in cooking amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Five Spice
safeIngredients.why: Chinese spice blend; safe in culinary amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Flavor
safeIngredients.why: General flavoring ingredient; safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Silicon Dioxide
safeIngredients.why: Anti-caking agent; passes through body unabsorbed. FDA approved and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Disodium Inosinate
safeIngredients.why: Flavor enhancer often paired with MSG; FDA approved and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Disodium Guanylate
safeIngredients.why: Flavor enhancer often paired with MSG; FDA approved and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Sodium Stearoyl Lactylate
safeIngredients.why: Dough conditioner in bread; FDA approved and safe.

safeIngredients.name: DATEM
safeIngredients.why: Dough strengthener in commercial bread; FDA approved and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Dextrin
safeIngredients.why: Modified starch used as thickener or fiber; safe and easily digestible.

safeIngredients.name: Cyclodextrin
safeIngredients.why: Ring-shaped starch molecule used for encapsulation; FDA approved and safe.

safeIngredients.name: Acetic Acid
safeIngredients.why: The acid in vinegar; safe and commonly used in food preservation.

safeIngredients.name: Propionic Acid
safeIngredients.why: Natural mold inhibitor; safe in food amounts. FDA approved.

safeIngredients.name: Sorbic Acid
safeIngredients.why: Mold and yeast inhibitor; safe and widely used food preservative.

safeIngredients.name: Benzoic Acid
safeIngredients.why: Naturally found in berries and cinnamon; safe food preservative.

safeIngredients.name: Sodium Erythorbate
safeIngredients.why: Antioxidant preservative similar to vitamin C; safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: EDTA
safeIngredients.why: Chelating agent that prevents discoloration; FDA approved in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Polydextrose
safeIngredients.why: Soluble fiber supplement; may help with digestive regularity during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Resistant Starch
safeIngredients.why: Prebiotic fiber that feeds beneficial gut bacteria; safe and beneficial.

safeIngredients.name: Hemp Protein
safeIngredients.why: Complete plant protein with omega-3 fatty acids; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Rice Protein
safeIngredients.why: Hypoallergenic plant protein; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Pumpkin Seed Protein
safeIngredients.why: Plant protein rich in iron and zinc; safe during pregnancy.

safeIngredients.name: Propylene Glycol
safeIngredients.why: FDA GRAS solvent and humectant; safe in food amounts used in flavorings and colors.

safeIngredients.name: Sodium Tripolyphosphate
safeIngredients.why: Used to retain moisture in seafood; FDA approved and safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Trisodium Phosphate
safeIngredients.why: pH regulator used in cereals and cheese; FDA approved and safe in food amounts.

safeIngredients.name: Ice
safeIngredients.why: Frozen water; completely safe.

safeIngredients.name: Carbon Dioxide
safeIngredients.why: Used for carbonation in drinks; safe. May cause bloating in some people.

safeIngredients.name: Tocopherols
safeIngredients.why: Natural vitamin E compounds used as antioxidants; safe and beneficial.

safeIngredients.name: Rosemary Extract Preservative
safeIngredients.why: Natural antioxidant preservative from rosemary; safe and effective.

concerningIngredients.name: Aspartame
concerningIngredients.why: Contains phenylalanine - dangerous for people with PKU. Safe for most in moderation, but consider alternatives.

concerningIngredients.name: Sucralose
concerningIngredients.why: One of the better-studied sweeteners; considered safe by FDA during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Saccharin
concerningIngredients.why: Crosses placenta and may accumulate in fetal tissue. Choose other sweeteners instead.

concerningIngredients.name: Acesulfame Potassium
concerningIngredients.why: Less studied than other sweeteners; use moderately during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Caffeine
concerningIngredients.why: Limit to under 200mg/day. Crosses placenta - baby can't metabolize it efficiently. One 12oz coffee = ~95-165mg.

concerningIngredients.name: High Fructose Corn Syrup
concerningIngredients.why: Not toxic but contributes to excess sugar intake linked to gestational diabetes and excessive weight gain.

concerningIngredients.name: Sodium Nitrate
concerningIngredients.why: Found in processed meats which should be limited. Can form nitrosamines when heated. Heat deli meats until steaming.

concerningIngredients.name: BHA
concerningIngredients.why: Classified as possible carcinogen. May be endocrine disruptor. Choose products without BHA when possible.

concerningIngredients.name: BHT
concerningIngredients.why: Limited pregnancy data. Less concerning than BHA but minimize when alternatives exist.

concerningIngredients.name: TBHQ
concerningIngredients.why: Found in many fast foods; high doses concerning in animal studies. Limit processed and fried foods.

concerningIngredients.name: Red 40
concerningIngredients.why: Linked to hyperactivity in some children. Contains benzidine. No nutritional benefit - purely cosmetic.

concerningIngredients.name: Yellow 5
concerningIngredients.why: Can cause allergic reactions, especially in aspirin-sensitive people. No nutritional benefit.

concerningIngredients.name: Yellow 6
concerningIngredients.why: May cause allergic reactions. Linked to hyperactivity. Banned or restricted in some countries.

concerningIngredients.name: Blue 1
concerningIngredients.why: Synthetic dye with limited safety data during pregnancy. No nutritional value.

concerningIngredients.name: Blue 2
concerningIngredients.why: Synthetic dye; some studies suggest potential health concerns. Unnecessary additive.

concerningIngredients.name: Green 3
concerningIngredients.why: Synthetic dye rarely used but concerning. Choose natural colors instead.

concerningIngredients.name: Titanium Dioxide
concerningIngredients.why: BANNED in EU since 2022 due to DNA damage concerns. Still allowed in US but many companies removing it.

concerningIngredients.name: Sodium Benzoate
concerningIngredients.why: Can form benzene (carcinogen) when combined with vitamin C. Avoid drinks with both sodium benzoate AND vitamin C.

concerningIngredients.name: Potassium Benzoate
concerningIngredients.why: Same concerns as sodium benzoate regarding benzene formation with vitamin C.

concerningIngredients.name: Sodium Sulfite
concerningIngredients.why: Can cause reactions in sulfite-sensitive people. Destroys thiamine (vitamin B1).

concerningIngredients.name: Potassium Bromate
concerningIngredients.why: Classified as possible carcinogen. BANNED in many countries. Avoid bromated flour products.

concerningIngredients.name: Propyl Gallate
concerningIngredients.why: Preservative with limited pregnancy safety data. Some studies suggest endocrine effects.

concerningIngredients.name: Carrageenan
concerningIngredients.why: May cause intestinal inflammation. Consider limiting if you have digestive sensitivities.

concerningIngredients.name: Polysorbate 80
concerningIngredients.why: Research suggests emulsifiers may affect gut health. Limit processed foods to reduce exposure.

concerningIngredients.name: Polysorbate 60
concerningIngredients.why: Similar concerns to Polysorbate 80 regarding gut health effects.

concerningIngredients.name: MSG
concerningIngredients.why: FDA considers safe. Body processes it same as natural glutamate in tomatoes and cheese. Sensitivity not confirmed in studies.

concerningIngredients.name: Natural Flavors
concerningIngredients.why: Umbrella term hiding hundreds of possible chemicals. Not required to list components. Contact manufacturer if concerned.

concerningIngredients.name: Artificial Flavors
concerningIngredients.why: Synthetic chemicals mimicking natural flavors. Safety generally accepted but limited pregnancy-specific data.

concerningIngredients.name: Partially Hydrogenated Oil
concerningIngredients.why: BANNED by FDA in 2018. Trans fats harm cardiovascular health and may interfere with fetal development. Check labels carefully.

concerningIngredients.name: Licorice Root
concerningIngredients.why: Studies link high consumption to PRETERM BIRTH and developmental effects. Avoid real licorice candy and supplements.

concerningIngredients.name: Ginseng
concerningIngredients.why: May have hormonal effects. Insufficient safety data during pregnancy. Avoid supplements; small amounts in food probably fine.

concerningIngredients.name: Guarana
concerningIngredients.why: Contains 2x the caffeine of coffee. Found in energy drinks which should be AVOIDED during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Pennyroyal
concerningIngredients.why: TOXIC during pregnancy. Can cause miscarriage. Never use pennyroyal in any form.

concerningIngredients.name: Dong Quai
concerningIngredients.why: May stimulate uterine contractions. Avoid during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Black Cohosh
concerningIngredients.why: May stimulate uterus. Not safe during pregnancy except possibly at term under medical supervision.

concerningIngredients.name: Blue Cohosh
concerningIngredients.why: Potentially dangerous during pregnancy. May cause birth defects or fetal heart problems.

concerningIngredients.name: Mugwort
concerningIngredients.why: Can stimulate uterine contractions and cause miscarriage. Avoid completely.

concerningIngredients.name: Wormwood
concerningIngredients.why: Contains thujone which can be toxic. Can cause miscarriage. Never consume during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Tansy
concerningIngredients.why: Highly toxic and can cause miscarriage. Never use during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Rue
concerningIngredients.why: Toxic herb that can cause miscarriage. Avoid completely during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Sassafras
concerningIngredients.why: Contains safrole, a known carcinogen banned by FDA. Avoid during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Ephedra
concerningIngredients.why: BANNED by FDA. Dangerous stimulant that can cause heart problems and is unsafe during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Kava
concerningIngredients.why: May cause liver damage. Insufficient safety data during pregnancy. Avoid completely.

concerningIngredients.name: Comfrey
concerningIngredients.why: Contains pyrrolizidine alkaloids that can cause liver damage. FDA recommends avoiding.

concerningIngredients.name: Goldenseal
concerningIngredients.why: May stimulate uterine contractions. Avoid during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Aloe Vera Latex
concerningIngredients.why: The latex (not gel) can cause contractions and diarrhea. Aloe vera GEL applied topically is safe.

concerningIngredients.name: Senna
concerningIngredients.why: Stimulant laxative - use only short-term if needed for constipation. Not for regular use.

concerningIngredients.name: Cascara
concerningIngredients.why: Stimulant laxative similar to senna. Only for short-term use if necessary.

concerningIngredients.name: Alcohol
concerningIngredients.why: NO safe amount during pregnancy. Can cause fetal alcohol spectrum disorders. Avoid completely.

concerningIngredients.name: Quinine
concerningIngredients.why: High doses can cause problems. Occasional tonic water probably fine, but don't drink it regularly.

concerningIngredients.name: Asafoetida
concerningIngredients.why: May stimulate menstruation. Safe in small cooking amounts; avoid supplements.

concerningIngredients.name: Fenugreek
concerningIngredients.why: Safe in food amounts. Supplements may stimulate uterus - avoid high doses during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Raw Sprouts
concerningIngredients.why: High risk of Salmonella, E. coli, and Listeria. Avoid raw sprouts completely during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Shark
concerningIngredients.why: VERY HIGH in mercury which harms baby's developing brain. Avoid completely during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Swordfish
concerningIngredients.why: VERY HIGH in mercury. Avoid completely during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: King Mackerel
concerningIngredients.why: VERY HIGH in mercury. Avoid completely during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Tilefish
concerningIngredients.why: VERY HIGH in mercury. Avoid completely during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Bigeye Tuna
concerningIngredients.why: HIGH in mercury. Limit all tuna and avoid bigeye specifically.

concerningIngredients.name: Marlin
concerningIngredients.why: HIGH in mercury. Avoid during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Orange Roughy
concerningIngredients.why: HIGH in mercury. Avoid during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Raw Fish
concerningIngredients.why: Risk of parasites and bacteria. All fish/shellfish should be cooked during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Unpasteurized Juice
concerningIngredients.why: Risk of E. coli and other bacteria. Choose pasteurized juices or make fresh and drink immediately.

concerningIngredients.name: Unpasteurized Milk
concerningIngredients.why: Risk of Listeria, Salmonella, E. coli. Always choose pasteurized dairy products.

concerningIngredients.name: Soft Unpasteurized Cheese
concerningIngredients.why: Risk of Listeria which can cause miscarriage. Choose pasteurized versions of soft cheeses.

concerningIngredients.name: Undercooked Eggs
concerningIngredients.why: Risk of Salmonella. Cook eggs until yolks are firm. Avoid foods with raw eggs.

concerningIngredients.name: Undercooked Meat
concerningIngredients.why: Risk of Toxoplasma and bacteria. Cook all meat to safe internal temperatures during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Deli Meat
concerningIngredients.why: Risk of Listeria. Heat until steaming (165°F) before eating. Or avoid during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Hot Dogs
concerningIngredients.why: Risk of Listeria. Heat until steaming hot (165°F) before eating.

concerningIngredients.name: Pâté
concerningIngredients.why: Risk of Listeria and very high in vitamin A. Avoid during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Liver
concerningIngredients.why: Extremely high in vitamin A which can cause birth defects in high amounts. Avoid during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Red 3
concerningIngredients.why: Banned in cosmetics due to thyroid tumor risk. FDA still allows in food but consider avoiding.

concerningIngredients.name: Citrus Red 2
concerningIngredients.why: Only allowed on orange peels. Classified as possible carcinogen. Don't eat orange peels.

concerningIngredients.name: Azodicarbonamide
concerningIngredients.why: Dough conditioner BANNED in EU and Australia. Breaks down into semicarbazide which has potential health concerns.

concerningIngredients.name: Propylparaben
concerningIngredients.why: Potential endocrine disruptor. Banned as food additive in EU. Still allowed in some US products.

concerningIngredients.name: Sodium Aluminum Phosphate
concerningIngredients.why: Contains aluminum which can accumulate in the body. Choose aluminum-free baking powder when possible.

concerningIngredients.name: Yarrow
concerningIngredients.why: Can stimulate uterine contractions. Avoid yarrow tea and supplements during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Juniper Berry
concerningIngredients.why: May stimulate uterine contractions and affect kidneys. Avoid during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Vitex
concerningIngredients.why: Affects hormones and prolactin levels. May interfere with pregnancy hormones. Avoid during pregnancy.

concerningIngredients.name: Motherwort
concerningIngredients.why: Can stimulate uterine contractions. Avoid during pregnancy despite traditional use postpartum.

concerningIngredients.name: CBD
concerningIngredients.why: FDA strongly advises against during pregnancy. Insufficient safety data. May affect fetal brain development.

concerningIngredients.name: Kratom
concerningIngredients.why: FDA warns against use. Can cause dependency and withdrawal in newborns. Avoid completely.

concerningIngredients.name: Excess Retinol
concerningIngredients.why: Over 10,000 IU/day of preformed vitamin A (retinol) can cause birth defects. Beta-carotene form is safe.

concerningIngredients.name: St. John's Wort
concerningIngredients.why: Interacts with many medications and may affect serotonin levels. Insufficient pregnancy safety data.

concerningIngredients.name: Valerian
concerningIngredients.why: Insufficient pregnancy safety data. Consult your doctor before using for sleep issues.

concerningIngredients.name: Diacetyl
concerningIngredients.why: Artificial butter flavoring linked to lung issues in workers. Limited pregnancy data. Avoid microwave popcorn fumes.
